text: General elections were held in Thailand on 12 December 1957. The result was a victory for the new United Land party, which won 40 of the 160 seats, although with 59 MPs, independents were the largest bloc in Parliament. Voter turnout was 44.1%.Dieter Nohlen, Florian Grotz & Christof Hartmann (2001) Elections in Asia: A data handbook, Volume II, p278 ==Results== {| class=wikitable style=text-align:right !Party !Votes !% !Seats !+/– |- |align=left|Sahaphum Party|| || ||44||New |- |align=left|Democrat Party|| || ||39||+9 |- |align=left|Economist Party|| || ||6||+3 |- |align=left|Free Democracy|| || ||5||–6 |- |align=left|Seri Manangkasila|| || ||4|||–82 |- |align=left|Nationalist Party|| || ||1||–2 |- |align=left|Hyde Park Movement Party|| || ||1||–1 |- |align=left|Independent Party|| || ||1||–1 |- |align=left|Independents|| || ||59||+51 |- |align=left|Invalid/blank votes|| ||–||–||– |- |align=left|Total||4,370,589||100||160||-123 |- |colspan=5 align=left|Source: Nohlen et al. |} ==References== Category:Elections in Thailand Category:1957 elections in Asia Category:1957 in Thailand
title: December 1957 Thai general election
